elements.text: To whomever holds this tome, beware what you seek for you might not like what you find.

Equestria is filled with magic of all different shapes and forms. Following recent events, however, it's has become plainly obvious that we do not fully understand all that there is about the world of Equestria. That is why the crown has tasked me with researching Magic in all of its forms, so we might utilise it and, I hope, save ourselves from the

pages.title: 1st Mare '12
elements: These 'Gemstones' are a common material found around the world. Earth Ponies dig them up all the time and don't think any much of it, but these stones have a special trait I found that lets them hold magic.
What's odd is that they seem to have some magical properties I haven't seen before.

extra.text: but I believe these may become useful for storing and applying complex spells, if I do so correctly...
I'm going to keep experimenting. Hooves-crossed, I'll update you tomorrow if I find anything.

pages.title: 2nd Mare '12
elements: This is amazing! These can do so much more than I could have ever imagined. Think of the advances I could bring to Equestria. Gem-powered lighting, heating, cooling, I'd no longer have to spend summer sitting on this-
I'm getting ahead of myself. Let me explain...

pages.title: Spellcrafting
elements: I drew a guide at the start of this book to help with the placement.
Put a raw gem-it mustn't have any spells already-in the middle and place materials around it in the slots I marked.
Each material gives different effects and putting them closer also enhances their influence on the gem.

pages.title: 3rd Mare '12
elements: I'm going to start documenting spell combinations as I find them. Some of them are pretty obvious, like gem + fire = fire gem
But some are less clear. For instance, what traits would an egg add?

pages.title: Botched Gems
elements: Okay, I guess not every combination works. That's dissapointing, and now I have all these useless stones piling up in my chambers.
I don't know what to do with them. They're not edible, I don't think.
They do still have the traits I gave them, so maybe I can find a use other than building a rock-fort with little Luna...
